modules.name: Data.Midi
modules.comments: Data structures used by the MIDI parser and by Web MIDI.

declarations.comments: A Midi Track.
declarations.title: Track

declarations.comments: The Midi Header.
declarations.title: Header

declarations.comments:
A Midi Event.

Note that RunningStatus messages are not included within Event
because the parser translates them to the underlying channel messages
declarations.title: Event

declarations.comments: a timestamped parsed MIDI Event message for use with Web MIDI
declarations.title: TimedEvent

declarations.comments: A MIDI Message.
declarations.title: Message

declarations.comments: A Midi Recording.
declarations.title: Recording

declarations.comments:
A Tick represents a MIDI time increment.  See the MIDI Specification,
page 135 - delta-time.
declarations.title: Ticks

declarations.comments: A MIDI byte (for use in a Byte array) and represented as an Int.
declarations.title: Byte

declarations.comments:
A MIDI Channel in the range ( 0 <= channel <= 15).
See the MIDI specification - page 7.
declarations.title: Channel

declarations.comments:
A MIDI note number representing a pitch in the range (0 <= note <= 127).
See the MIDI specification page 42 - Note Number.
0 in a NoteOn message is equivalent to NoteOff.
declarations.title: Note

declarations.comments:
An indication of the pressure applied to a key on a MIDI isntrument and
hence of note volume. See the MIDI specification page 42 - Volume.
declarations.title: Velocity

declarations.comments:
System exclusive messages exist in two different flavours as introduced by
a lead-in byte of 0xF0 or 0xF7.  See the MIDI specification page 135.
declarations.title: SysExFlavour

modules.name: Data.Midi.Generate
modules.comments:
Encode MIDI types as "binary"
adapted from the elm-comidi version courtesy of @rhofour.

declarations.comments:
The MIDI generation context. This differs according to whether we're
generating a file or an Event stream.
declarations.title: Context

declarations.comments: Generate a MIDI event.
declarations.title: event

declarations.comments: Generate a MIDI recording
declarations.title: recording

declarations.comments: generate a MIDI message
declarations.title: midiMessage

modules.name: Data.Midi.Instrument
modules.comments:
An enumeration of the virtual instruments defined by MIDI together with a
mapping to the instrument names defined in Benjamin Gleitzman's soundfont
library - https://github.com/gleitz/midi-js-soundfonts.
See the MIDI specification, page 150 - the General MIDI Sound Set.

declarations.comments: MIDI instrument names
declarations.title: InstrumentName

declarations.comments: the set of supported instruments
declarations.title: instrumentNames

declarations.comments:
Convert a MIDI instrument name to a Gleitzman name
for example ElectricPiano1 -> electric_piano_1
declarations.title: gleitzmanName

declarations.comments: the set of supported instruments, using the Gleitzman names
declarations.title: gleitzmanNames

declarations.comments: read a Gleitzman instrument name amd attempt to convert to a MIDI instrument.
declarations.title: read

modules.name: Data.Midi.Parser
modules.comments: A parser for MIDI recordings or for MIDI event streams

declarations.comments:
Normalise the input. The un-normalised input can by obtained (for example)
by using readAsBinaryString or else by using XMLHttpRequest and then  making
use of the override MIME type hack.

This function masks off all but the least significant 8 bits and treats the
result as a character array.
declarations.title: normalise

declarations.comments: Parse a normalised MIDI string.
declarations.title: parse

declarations.comments: Parse a MIDI event that emanates from a Web MIDI connection to the browser.
declarations.title: parseMidiEvent

declarations.comments: Parse a MIDI message.  Probably only useful for debug purposes.
declarations.title: parseMidiMessage

modules.name: Data.Midi.WebMidi
modules.comments:
This module provides plug and play support for MIDI input devices such as
MIDI keyboards.

declarations.comments: The WEBMIDI Effect.
declarations.title: WEBMIDI

declarations.comments: A 'raw' Midi Event where the event has not been decoded.
declarations.title: RawMidiEvent

declarations.comments: A Midi Device.
declarations.title: Device

declarations.comments: try to connect to Web-Midi.
declarations.title: webMidiConnect

declarations.comments: detect any input device as it connects or disconnects
declarations.title: detectInputDevices

declarations.comments: listen to 'raw' web-MIDI event messages.
declarations.title: listen

declarations.comments: create a channel for MIDI device connections/disconnections and feed it from web-midi
declarations.title: createDeviceChannel

declarations.comments: create a channel for MIDI timed event messages and feed it from web-midi
declarations.title: createEventChannel
